title: Australia news live: Marles hails Rudd’s role in White House meeting as Turnbull praises former PM for ‘delivering the goods’
summary: Could you please provide the news content you'd like summarized?

title: Bob Vylan ‘not regretful’ about IDF chant at Glastonbury: ‘I’d do it again tomorrow’
summary: In an interview with Louis Theroux, Bobby Vylan, frontman of the band, discussed the backlash they received after their performance at Glastonbury. He downplayed the criticism, stating it was 'minimal' in comparison to the struggles faced by Palestinians. Vylan emphasized the importance of focusing on more significant global issues.

title: Federal appeals court moves to reconsider ruling in Trump’s favor on Portland troop deployment – as it happened
summary: The Oregon attorney general expressed concern over a recent decision permitting President Trump to deploy troops to Portland, stating that the state is "on a dangerous path." This move comes amidst ongoing protests and tensions in the city. The attorney general fears implications for civil rights and public safety.

title: University of Arizona becomes seventh US college to reject Trump’s ‘compact’
summary: The administration is urging nine universities to enter into an agreement aimed at aligning their policies with conservative principles. This initiative seeks to implement changes in various academic and administrative areas. Critics argue that it could undermine academic freedom and diversity of thought.

title: Construction begins on Trump’s $250m White House ballroom
summary: An ex-congressman has condemned the major renovation of the East Wing as "utter desecration." Reports indicate that demolition work is currently in progress. These comments highlight concerns over the preservation of historical integrity during the renovation.
